text: I thought the plane was gonna be fine...
Hey, if you’re gonna puke, do it outside!
Flying around like this—what if Shinra shows up?
The sky don’t belong to nobody. Shinra can eat shit for all I care!
Hahahaha! Man, I like you! That’s the spirit!
Looks like we’re getting pretty close.
This is as far as I can guide ya.
Can’t get any closer than this, so just hoof it from here!
What do we do next time we need a ride?
If there’s a runway, I’ll do my damnedest.
I’ll guide you to the valley.
That’s Cosmo Canyon—my beautiful, noble hometown.
Whoa~ The holy land of planetology’s callin’ me!
So, I hate to bring this up again, but...
Y’all keep goin’ on about Sephiroth bein’ the enemy and all that jazz, right?
Assumin’ what y’all say is true—that the great hero ain’t dead—
What’s that guy up to these days?
Seems he’s trying to protect the planet.
Huh? Sounds like a decent fella to me!
If it’s to save the planet, he doesn’t care what happens to people. That’s his way.
Well, that’s mighty extreme~ Cities need people, and so does the planet!
I’ll bring somethin’ up too—there’s another enemy out there!
Not only do they keep gettin’ in our way, but they’re still suckin’ energy outta the planet—the Shinra Company!
We’ll use your connections to the max, but if you double-cross us...
It’s the cat-punishment treatment! I don’t let shit slide!
Good to see you safe. Really good!
Now, go say hi to Elder Bugenhagen!
These folks helped me out a little.
They’re not bad people, so let ‘em in!
This morning, someone dropped outta the sky.
Seems they’re the ones who blew up Midgar’s mako reactor...
But you folks don’t seem connected to that.
With Nanaki’s introduction, there’s no problem.
Welcome to Cosmo Canyon, the holy land of planetology!
I was born and raised in this beautiful valley.
I was supposed to become a warrior to protect this valley, but I got captured by Shinra...
I’ve repaid the debt for being saved. Now I think I’ll return to my original path here.
Thanks for everything up ‘til now. I’m grateful.
It’s gonna feel lonely without you.
Don’t say that~! It’ll make parting even harder!
But protecting this valley is my calling.
You sneaky bastard, trickin’ us all this time!
Lots of folks look down on me, callin’ me a dog or whatever.
If he’s in the valley, we’ll get chances to talk, right?
So what’s our goal comin’ here?
Guess I’ll just space out for a bit~
Those Avalanche wanted posters didn’t look like us at all!
They’ve gotta have some kinda plan.
Those Weapons we saw in Corel and Gongaga—
Seein’ ‘em proves the planet’s crisis ain’t just some fantasy—it’s real, and anyone’d believe it!
And look at the faces of these planetology folks gathered here—
Every single one’s an Avalanche comrade!
Treasure, materia, where are ya~? Don’t be shy—come on out~♪
May you be with the planet.
Here, planetology learners gather to talk,
holding seminars to reaffirm the joy of living with the planet.
Joining the seminars requires an introduction from a proper mentor.
Today, the "Rite of the Stars" is being held, so how about joining that instead?
May you be with the planet.
Planetology seminars are by introduction only.
Today, the "Rite of the Stars" is being held, so how about joining that instead?
Ho ho ho! Seems Nanaki owes you a lot!
I know a thing or two about the planet and teach planetology here in Cosmo Canyon.
A thing or two? Gramps, is there even anything you don’t know?
Well, I know more than a kid like you, that’s for sure!
In human terms, he’s about 15 or 16 years old.
I’m an adult now! I can protect this valley—and you too, Gramps!
Nanaki, have you already said hi to everyone in the valley?
Sorry ‘bout that. Feel free to take a look around inside!
Seems you’ve toughened Nanaki up. Has he grown stronger from seein’ the outside world?
Ho ho ho! Lots of rare gadgets ‘round here, eh?
They’re all tools tied to the planet!
That’s a real early mako detector.
Hmm...Guess it’s finally reached its limit.
It’s a device for recordin’ the planet’s cycles.
It’s a delicate piece, so handle it with care!
A miniature of the planet and its surroundin’ stars.
You could say the dust pilin’ up is like humanity itself!
Crystals of the planet’s memories...They hold a shine beyond what the eye can see.
Ho ho! Touch that, and you’ll cause an avalanche!
That’s a model of an airflow generator. It moves with wind and creates new currents.
Have you already seen the real thing?
Old footage of Nanaki. Back then, he was always up to mischief!
No rush—save that spot for later!
The world’s biggest telescope for observin’ the stars’ cycles!
The starry sky through this is the best, but the lens is all foggy now.
The planet’s cries—a sorrowful tune. I’ve been hearin’ it a lot lately.
It comes up through the pipes from deep underground.
That’s not the planet’s cries—it’s the voice of the Weapons protectin’ it!
At Gongaga and Corel’s mako reactors—they were huge...
Ho ho ho! That’s quite an interestin’ tale!
But...mako poisoning’s got all kinda symptoms. Be careful!
Seems you folks haven’t properly studied planetology yet.
This is a good chance—come with me!
The latest model’s at Shinra HQ, they say, but this here’s my original!
Ho ho! It’s too early to be amazed!
The planet, the cosmos, the beings livin’ in it—their workings.
Knowin’ the flow of life is the foundation of planetology!
Humans were born on this planet, brimmin’ with rich life.
People live, and eventually, they die.
But what happens when they die?
The body decays and returns to the planet.
But what about the mind, the heart, the spirit?
Truth is, the spirit returns to the planet too!
Spirits that return mix together and race ‘round the planet.
They flow, merge, split, becomin’ a swell called the Lifestream.
The Lifestream...In other words, the flow of spiritual energy circlin’ the planet!
For the planet to stay a planet, it needs that spiritual energy.
But if that spiritual energy runs out...
That’s the bare basics of planetology!
Mako’s a waste of spiritual energy—that’s a fact, right?
Spiritual energy that’s sucked up and processed can’t fulfill its original purpose anymore.
It gets used up in machines and vanishes.
Couldn’t it return to the Lifestream and turn into somethin’ else instead?
A new theory...no, a wild one!
Take this young lady to the seminar room!
If the cycle of life fades, the planet breaks and ends.
Like, say, strengthenin’ the cycle of life?
But maybe my planetology’s gettin’ outdated.
Never before have folks messed with the planet this deep in history.
I’m an old geezer now. It’s a shame I can’t keep up with learnin’.
Not interested in planetology? You oughta join the seminar!
Check it—today’s the "Star Sending" festival, they say! Let’s go take a peek later!
This, that—everything’s fake! This place is so boring!
Planetology or whatever’s prolly just fake scholars actin’ all high and mighty, huh?
How’d these old books survive this long~?
That nice old paper smell—it’s makin’ me all dreamy!
May you be with the planet.
I’ve heard from Elder Bugenhagen. Please, go ahead.
The "Rite of the Stars" is about to start.
It’s the one night a year Cosmo Canyon bonds with the planet.
I’m sure there’ll be blessings for you too!
Ever since I was little, I’ve had a big body, but I preferred painting and poetry over hard labor.
My father always lamented that I was pathetic, stayin’ indoors all the time.
By his logic, I’d be wastin’ tons of spiritual energy—a burden on the planet.
I believe I’ve been entrusted with more spiritual energy than others by the planet,
refinin’ it with rich intellect and emotion to give back to the planet someday.
That’s what I believe is the meanin’ of my life.
May you be with the planet!
I believe there’s another world where my mom and dad are still alive.
I’ve been studyin’ to figure out how to get there somehow.
And here, I’ve gained incredible teachings.
The Lifestream...spiritual energy—I heard its true nature is knowledge and memories.
Maybe wishes and dreams are mixed in there too.
Maybe spiritual energy doesn’t distinguish between real memories and unfulfilled wishes or dreams.
When someone happens to touch that energy, could they see another world?
That’s the conclusion I’ve reached from studyin’ here.
May you be with the planet!
Keep up your studies from here on out!
So, who’s speakin’ next? Let me know when you’re ready!
Inside the Lifestream, it’s such a beautiful place.
It makes you remember all kinda things.
You feel kindness toward someone, or it reconnects you to forgotten feelings.
The planet’s core is a warm place.
But there was a battle there too.
A fight between the planet and an enemy threatenin’ it.
I...we have to live with the planet.
Together with the planet, we’ve gotta face the enemy...the crisis.
But I still don’t know how to fight it.
I thought I’d figured it out here, but...
I’m not criticizing Planetology or anything. I don’t mean to scare anyone either.
Sorry, I’m not good at explaining this.
No need to worry about it.
We’ll always be here waiting for you.
Keep thinking. The answers only lie at the end of that road.
Now, it’s nearly time for the Sending. Everyone, let’s head to the candles.
Today’s the Day of the Sending.
Once a year, we return the souls gathered in the valley to the planet.
I was just talkin’ to the mentor earlier.
He says it’s arrogant for people to try savin’ the planet. "The planet’s future’s up to the planet. If it gets dirty, it’ll clean itself", he says.
So what? We just sit back? Shut up and study or somethin’?
Are we supposed to just ignore it? Keep quiet and hit the books?
Are we supposed to just keep quiet and study?
If we don’t fight, nothing’ll change.
Right? I’m countin’ on ya, Cloud my man!
Ignore it? Hell no! But fightin’ all the time don’t feel right either.
How do we protect it, then?
Planetology’s just a buncha theories. Got that loud and clear.
Wonder what the planet’s sayin’ about it.
Compared to the cosmos, humans are tiny little things.
I’ve lived my life pushin’ back against folks who say that with smug faces.
But man, we really are wee, aren’t we?
The sky’s huge, and I’m tiny.
Makes ya think all sorts o’ things, huh?
That stuff about dead people returnin’ to the planet?
I don’t believe a single bit of it, not even this much!
When you’re dead, it’s all poof, right?
When you’re dead, it’s all poof, right?
Right? That’s why I’m gonna survive no matter what!
I don’t believe in stuff I haven’t seen myself. That’s it.
Huh? Ugh, askin’ Cloud was a mistake.
Guess you saw me at my most embarrassing, huh?
Guess you saw me at my most embarrassing, huh?
Those who get it, get it. It’s on the listener.
I’m not good at talking either.
Guess we’re both in for a tough time, huh?
Just laugh it off next time.
I’m not good at that either. Maybe I’m too serious?
I wanna stay like this a little longer.
Back when I was really a kid...
That day, we sat around this fire just like this with Mom and Dad...
I’ll listen if you wanna talk.
I’ll listen if you wanna talk.
Talking about Mom makes my chest feel like it’s gonna burst with pride.
But when I think about Dad...
Guess I’ll talk about it another time.
I don’t hate that side of you, Cloud.
You started it. Don’t stop halfway.
Cloud, I recently learned a word called "delicacy."
It’s used like "lacking delicacy" or "not enough delicacy."
Guess I’ll talk about it another time.
The highlight of this festival’s coming up soon.
I’m an Ancient, a descendant of the Cetra who cultivated this planet long ago.
There’s only one other like me left in this world.
Since I was little, I’ve been watched or locked up.
There’s not a single good thing about it.
No matter how much fun I have, thinking about my blood ruins it all.
I’ve longed for a normal life, then given up on it.
But because I’m like this, I’ve met comrades, friends.
So I’m okay now. It’s paid off.
I want to be a good person so we can stay together forever.
Even if a normal life’s out of reach...
Now, let us send them off.
I’ve got something to tell you. Will you all come along too?
What’d you think of the Sending Ceremony?
Lately, for some reason, more folks are comin’ just to see the ritual.
Ask ‘em what they think, and it’s "Beautiful", "Moving", "Grand", "I cried."
Well, nine outta ten’ll say somethin’ like that.
It’s good their hearts are stirred. The Sending Ceremony’s got that power, and that’s grand.
But those willin’ to take a step further and study Planetology? Hardly any.
Dogs, cats, birds, fish, and flowers—
A baby’s born, a flower blooms—Anyone’d feel life’s presence there.
It’s the same with the planet.
Ho ho...Sorry, I got a bit complainy there.
Age’ll do that—can’t stop the gripin’ and preachin’.
Ho ho ho! Well then, shall we get goin’?
Aye, it’s the one I sealed and forbade anyone from enterin’.
From here, you’ll take a trial.
If you wanna be a warrior protectin’ this valley, you can’t avoid it.
This trial’ll need your friends’ help too.
We’re headin’ somewhere a bit dangerous, so let me know when you’re ready.
Will you take on Nanaki’s trial?
Head deeper and deeper into this cave.
Did Nanaki tell you about his parents?
Both my parents were warriors who protected the valley.
So when the enemy attacked the valley, Mom fought bravely and gave her life to defend it.
But my coward of a dad...He ran off on his own.
So you still can’t forgive Seto, huh?
From here on, only the one takin’ the trial and one witness can go forward.
Ho ho ho! You’d be no good for Nanaki’s training.
You’re the right one for this.
The cave’s dangerous. Please take utmost care.
May the planet be with you.
Make sure you watch me, okay?
Yeah, I’ll stare holes into ya!
The ones sealed at the valley’s depths—a place swirling with their sorrow.
You should be able to climb it.
This place gives me the creeps.
Forty-five years ago, a fierce battle unfolded right here.
No way...The Gi made it this far in?
What’s this Gi-whatever you’re talkin’ about?
A tribe unknown to anyone outside this valley. Don’t rush— you’ll see soon enough.
Oi, old man! Hide somewhere ‘til this is over!
Ho ho! I’d do that even without ya tellin’ me.
You can’t judge a thing’s essence by its looks alone.
But...it’s true their power was immense.
Figure out what happened here in your own way.
Seek our relics, carry them, uncover the truth. Only then will the path open.
Ho ho! That’s just a bone.
Hmm, this...It’d make a fine toy for you.
Oh, memories of battle...The time of our awakening draws near...
They say the poison on the arrowhead spreads fast, turnin’ ya to stone in no time.
A weapon used by the valley folk.
This pattern on the handle—same as the one on your body, ain’t it?
Memories of souls orbiting the planet, knowledge, crystallized—Commonly called Materia these days.
Seek our relics, carry them, uncover the truth. Only then will the path open.
Even after perishin’ in battle with us, their hatred grew, and now they wander this cave.
They’ve got their own reasons. Don’t look down on the defeated.
Even this statue’s here for a reason. Don’t treat it carelessly.
Feels more like a cursed chamber, don’t it?
Ho ho ho! That’s a mighty interestin’ take.
Just as everything has no meaning.
You know what to do, Nanaki.
Our remains...Carry the statue and enshrine it at the rightful altar.
No, enshrine it at the rightful altar.
Our remains...Carry the statue and enshrine it at the rightful altar.
Thousands of years ago, this valley’s history began with the arrival of the Gi.
This altar was built back then to seal the Gi away.
If the Gi were sealed ages ago, why’d they attack the valley that day?
Their truth’s somethin’ only they know.
This cave’s the boundary between the Gi and the human world.
If the Gi broke through here, the valley wouldn’t’ve stood a chance.
But one warrior noticed this defenseless cave.
That lone warrior came to this cave. Sure enough, it was crawlin’ with Gi.
Fightin’ off wave after wave of Gi, the warrior ran and ran.
Hey, Gramps, if they were that brave, I’d know about a warrior like that!
From here on, be extra careful. The evil aura’s gettin’ stronger.
Fear slips into your heart in an instant.
But don’t let it rule you. You’re your own master.
Pass through all the doors ahead, and the trial’s done.
How the hell do we open this?
Our regrets, we’ll settle them now!
We’ll wipe you out right here!
Let’s go. Our destination’s just ahead.
Ho ho! It looks similar, but it’s different. Much, much older—built long, long ago.
The last altar was made to seal the Gi.
This one was crafted by the Cetra to speak with the Gi.
Speak with them? Why? The Gi are enemies, right?
Good and evil, friend and foe—such distinctions are just defined by the times.
Now, Nanaki, carve your own path with your strength.
Ho ho ho...Sorrow, too, keeps changing its shape.
Forty-five years ago, a lone warrior came here and took it all upon themselves.
So, did I pass the warrior trial?
Ho ho ho! I can’t decide that on my own.
Let’s hear that warrior’s opinion too.
That warrior fought alone here to protect the valley—and even now, he keeps guarding us.
His body turned to stone from poisoned arrows, but his gallant form stands unbroken, unyielding.
Ho ho ho! Aye, she knew.
They both asked me to seal this cave.
If I’d told you, wouldn’t you have come here alone to see him?
The one thing your parents wanted to protect most—it was none other than...
Because I was small and weak?
That small, powerless Nanaki has grown into a fine warrior.
That’s why I brought you here.
Nanaki, keep traveling as you are.
I’m a warrior of the valley!
Like Dad, I’ll stay here forever—
I didn’t want to believe what Cloud and the others were saying.
Sounded like something those seminar folks’d cook up.
Even when I see or hear something new, feels like I already know it somehow.
My eyes’ve started missing the chance of great wisdom that might be out there.
I don’t wanna hold the youngsters back.
Go, Nanaki! Don’t let this valley stain you with an old man’s colors.
My eyes are cloudy, my ears clogged—see the world in my stead!
You failed the trial—go train and come back!
You can do it, right, Nanaki?
The son of the warrior Seto!
O valiant and daring warrior Seto, we wish to entrust our hopes to your kin once more.
As expected of Seto—our thanks for your generous heart.
Ho ho hooo! Things just got interesting, huh?
That one’s likely a living Gi spirit. Look after Nanaki, will ya?
Ho ho ho! See, hear, touch—enjoy the world!
Lord Bugenhagen will be escorted back by us.
May the planet be with you.
I’ve got no clue what’s goin’ on—what is this?
I’m a materia hunter, right? Fightin’ for Wutai and all that~
Could ya quiet down a wee bit? This ain’t exactly a normal situation to stay calm in.
But that Gi guy’s all polite and stuff!
That’s the kinda thing that’s actually the scariest. Don’t let your guard down!
We’d like to guide you to our home.
If we go, will there be somethin’ good? Like, an awesome materia or somethin’?
Quite the coincidence. We, too, seek materia.
Try matching your body to the boat’s sway.
Like I can do somethin’ that fancy~
After you jumped aboard so eagerly...
Is it bad if they hear?
If the planet knows, it’ll soon reach the Cetra’s ears.
The Cetra lack a bit of...tolerance, you see.
I’m a descendant of the Cetra, though.
It seems you’ve only inherited their blood.
You’ve left the Cetra’s story behind somewhere, haven’t you?
The days of the Cetra were harsh. Ignorance might let you live longer.
People of the planet, you’ve done well to come.
The Gi’s consciousness lingers even without flesh—it never fades.
The planet won’t accept the consciousness of outsiders like us.
That’s a tough spot. I feel for ya.
This statue is a vessel for the Gi who’ve lost their bodies.
Please lend them an ear—they’re starving for someone to listen.
The planet won’t accept the outsider Gi.
They can’t return to the Lifestream, huh?
So they don’t die? That’s invincible!
But it’s not like they’re alive either, aye?
That half-baked state—ain’t it worse than dyin’?
For us, there’s neither death nor life.
Our fate—not accepted by the planet—we searched for a way to heal ourselves.
The Gi sought a materia of healing...
The Gi sought ultimate healing in materia...
The ultimate healing—nothingness. Returning to nothing is our deepest wish.
The Gi entrusted their wish to pure materia...
This place don’t feel too good.
For the Gi, healing’s becomin’ nothing.
Their wish is to vanish from this planet—or else wipe the planet out with ‘em?
Wouldn’t it be better if someone reliable like me managed that materia?
I reckon stayin’ outta this’d be smarter.
Looks like it’s too late for that.
What’re they gonna ask us to do?
The Gi’s wish stained pure materia black...
The Gi’s wish stained pure materia black...
The Gi’s wish stained pure materia black...
Looks like we can’t avoid this materia.
I won’t play into his hands.
No tellin’ how far we can fool ‘em, but let’s play along.
Our homeland, our planet, grew old and faded, becoming part of this planet.
The sky split, the earth cracked, the seas vanished, and time unraveled.
A handful of Gi survived that chaos and became dwellers of this planet.
But to the planet, the Gi were foreign.
We’re not allowed to fade into the planet’s consciousness—the Lifestream.
Bound to this land under the planet’s watch...
Unable to live or vanish, enduring a meaningless torment of time.
Our deepest wish became liberation from this suffering.
We obtained pure materia nurtured by the planet and poured our clan’s wish into it.
The materia finally accepted our wish, and we gained the great materia of healing.
We rejoiced, thinking our wish would finally come true—but that joy was short-lived.
The hated Cetra invaded this land and stole our treasure.
We call that jet-black orb the "Black Materia."
Please, return the Black Materia to us.
That is the wish we entrust to you.
If a Cetra descendant aids us, our long-standing grudge might finally fade.
I’ve heard the Black Materia is hidden in the Cetra’s temple.
O hollow one, can we trust you?
I’ll read your future, folks! A bright future, a fun future!
If he says it’s fine, it’s fine. Trust him.
O people of the planet, O brave ones...
Please bring the Black Materia to this land.
We’ll guide you to Lord Bugenhagen. This way, please.
May the planet be with you.
Those Gi spectres think we’re gonna bring ‘em the materia!
They kept ramblin’ ‘bout "great healing" or whatever,
But basically, it’s some damn terrifying materia with insane power.
Yeah, no way we’re handin’ it over to them.
We gotta find it before they do.
If you say Sephiroth was there, then he was there, man.
So, so—Sephiroth’s after the Black Materia too!?
Big trouble—we can’t waste time! The Black Materia’s mine!
Hey, Cait Sith, how do you know about the Cetra temple?
I don’t exactly "know"—more like I’ve got a hunch.
Way back, I saw it in some company files. If we’ve got a Shinra terminal, I can look it up.
Is there a terminal in Cosmo Canyon too?
Looks like you made it back safe! That’s a relief, a big relief.
No need to worry anymore, Gramps! I’m the son of the warrior Seto, after all.
There’s supposed to be a terminal connected to Shinra’s network set up in this valley somewhere.
Ho ho! You mean that terminal, eh?
Sure enough, we had one. It used some rare parts, so I got curious, y’see.
Took it apart, and well, there ya go.
Now it’s workin’ hard as this valley’s generator!
Then, do you know about the Cetra’s temple?
The Cetra didn’t need gods. They wouldn’t have built somethin’ like a temple, I reckon.
It was probably outsiders who called it a temple.
There’s a legend that a Cetra structure’s hidden somewhere out there. It’s written in plenty o’ books.
The Cetra were a race that walked a harsh path.
Even if you find it, it’s not a place you can just waltz into, I’d wager.
If you’re goin’, be plenty careful.
See it, hear it, touch it. There’s gotta be somethin’ there you can’t get from books.
If you make it back safe, tell me all about it, eh?
Another one o’ those black cloaks showed up. What should we do?
Oh? A friend of yours, maybe?
Let’s go check it out, Cloud.
Ho ho ho! The turnin’ of the planet sure is a curious thing.
Gotta close this gate up again, I suppose.
The black cloak’s at the valley entrance. Some of our folks should be lookin’ after ‘em by now.
Let us know if you spot any shady characters.
We’ve been seein’ a lot of these lately. Some say it’s Mako poisoning, but these symptoms...
If it’s there, then there’s definitely a Shinra terminal!
Cloud, you said earlier, that it’s fine to trust what I say, right?
Maybe it was just to get by in the moment.
But I wanna make your words the real deal, Cloud!
There ain’t no land route connected to it.
Then let’s head back to the airstrip!
We’ll take care of this fella here, so don’t you worry none.
Thank you for choosin’ Bronco Air! We sincerely appreciate your business!
Cid, my man! Can you take us to Nibelheim?
Well, I’ll figure somethin’ out. With me behind the stick, anywhere’s just a hop away!
It’s faint, but I’ve detected a response from Ancient Matter nearby.
It doesn’t seem like the Ancient Matter is actually present at this location, though...
This appears to be one of the Cosmo Canyon ruins.
Treasure, materia, where ya at~? Don’t be shy now, come on out~♪
Yeah, and you too...I’m so glad.
I’m tougher than I look, y’know~?
These here are the OG Avalanche crew. They’ve helped us out a ton.
And, well, you already know the splinter group folks.
Did you guys hit the Shinra Building? Did ya see our Wedge anywhere?
Anything, just tell me what ya know!
Nah, I still wanna hear it.
When the Sector 7 plate went down like that, our hearts got all messed up.
Our hearts turned into a pile o’ rubble too.
That’s when we got an offer from the main branch leadership.
The plate fall was Shinra’s own doing. Occupy the Shinra Building to stop their next move.
Weapons and gear provided. All who’ve got the will, gather up—
We felt like we had to join in.
Wedge was in the same truck as me.
We’ll infiltrate the Shinra Building from the underground parking lot. Secure each floor and link up with the advance team.
We’ve lost contact with the Lutia squad.
No speculation. Get in touch with Captain Matt first.
Up we go, up we go!
Wedge from the splinter group, reportin’ in!
The squad’s goal was to take out the President.
I know, it wasn’t like us at all.
But back then, we were all in.
C’mon, get fired up! You’ll get left behind!
The time’s come to take the world back into our hands! Unleash your anger and hatred on ‘em!
I’ve gotta get in touch with my crew no matter what!
If I don’t tell ‘em our plan soon, it’s gonna get all crossed up!
That’s as far as our momentum got us.
The heli crew’s wiped out. The backup’s been trashed too, looks like!
Couldn’t reach the President’s office! Pulling back now—
You heard that just now, right? Wedge’s voice—
